question: 駿馬
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>speed</kanji> <kanji>horse</kanji> is a <vocabulary>fast horse</vocabulary>, and a <vocabulary>fine horse</vocabulary>. This word isn't very common, but it does come up in horse racing contexts, and creative writing.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
You learned the reading for <ja>駿</ja> with the kanji, but <ja>馬</ja> has two possible readings in this word, and you only learned <ja>ば</ja>. Here's a mnemonic to help you remember <ja>め</ja>:

This <vocabulary>fast horse</vocabulary> is so fast that all you can see as it speeds past are the whites of its <reading><ja>目</ja></reading> (<ja>め</ja>).

Of the two readings, <ja>しゅんめ</ja> is the more common.
